info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 3:53PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 353 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Camp Navajo, or 11 miles west of Flagstaff, moving northeast at 10 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Flagstaff, Camp Navajo, Bellemont, Garland Prairie, Rogers Lake, Government Prairie, Wing Mountain, Scholz Lake, Parks, A1 Mountain, Lava River Cave, Whitehorse Lake, Sycamore Falls, Flagstaff Ranch, A One Lake, Fort Valley, Railroad Springs, Maine, Riordan and Sycamore Canyon Wilderness.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 176 and 194. Route 66 between mile markers 192 and 194. Highway 180 between mile markers 224 and 228.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... White Horse Lake Campground, Camp Raymond and Woody Mountain Campground.
This includes the following swimming holes... Sycamore Falls, Lower Sycamore Falls "The Golden Pond" and Paradise Forks.
info.instruction:
Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT COCONINO COUNTY UNTIL 430 PM MST

area.areaDesc: Western Mogollon Rim; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons
